SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

android.health.pedometer
Class PedometerDatabaseAdapter

java.lang.Object
  android.health.pedometer.PedometerDatabaseAdapter

public class PedometerDatabaseAdapter
extends java.lang.Object

This class strictly handles interaction between the exercise sessions database and the rest of the app, only this class should directly touch the database at any point. See, now we know Google isn't evil.

Author:
Joel Botner

Constructor Detail

PedometerDatabaseAdapter

public PedometerDatabaseAdapter(Context theContext)
Constructor - takes the context to allow the database to be opened/created. NOTE: You need to create this adapter in an actual Activity. Share the created adapter object with other classes if necessary, but create it in an Activity.

Parameters:
theContext - the Context within which to work
Method Detail

open

public PedometerDatabaseAdapter open()
                              throws SQLException
Open the sessions database. If it cannot be opened, try to create a new instance of the database. If it cannot be created, throw an exception to signal the failure

Returns:
this (self reference, allowing this to be chained in an initialization call)
Throws:
SQLException - if the database could be neither opened or created

close

public void close()

createSession

public long createSession(java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.String distance,
                          java.lang.String time,
                          long date,
                          java.lang.String type,
                          java.lang.String calories)
Creates a new entry in the exercise session database with the specified attributes.

Parameters:
title - - The title of this session.
distance - - The distance (in meters) estimated to have traveled.
time - - The amount of time (in milliseconds) the session took.
date - - The date according to the GregorianCalendar this is (in milliseconds).
type - - The type of exercise this was.
calories - - The estimated number of calories that were burned.
Returns:
The Row ID of this new entry.

deleteSession

public boolean deleteSession(long rowId)
Delete the note with the given rowId

Parameters:
rowId - id of note to delete
Returns:
true if deleted, false otherwise

getCalsBurnedSince

public int getCalsBurnedSince(long date)
This is merely a convenience method that tallies up the calories from all sessions that began after the passed point in time.

Parameters:
date - The beginning date and time (millis in form dictated by GregorianCalendar)
Returns:
The number of calories burned since the specified time.

fetchAllSessions

public Cursor fetchAllSessions()
Return a Cursor over the list of all notes in the database

Returns:
Cursor over all notes

fetchAllSessionsAfter

public Cursor fetchAllSessionsAfter(long date)
Returns a Cursor containing all exercise sessions on or after a certain date.

Parameters:
date - - The date (must be in the standard millisecond format of java.util.Calendar and referring to midnight)
Returns:
A cursor pointing to all exercise sessions on or after a certain date.

fetchSession

public java.lang.String fetchSession(long rowId)
                              throws SQLException
Return a String containing the attributes of the row in tab-delimited format.

Parameters:
rowId - id of session to retrieve
Returns:
String containing the attributes in tab-delimited format.
Throws:
SQLException - if session could not be found/retrieved

updateSession

public boolean updateSession(long rowId,
                             java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String distance,
                             java.lang.String time,
                             java.lang.String date,
                             java.lang.String type,
                             java.lang.String calories)
Update the session using the details provided. The session to be updated is specified using the rowId, and it is altered to use the new values passed in

Parameters:
rowId - - The database id of the session, if you know it.
title - - The title of the session
distance - - Estimated distance traveled in a session
time - - Time taken to complete a session
date - - Date a session began
type - - Type of exercise this session was (bike, running, or walking)
calories - - Estimated number of calories burned this session
Returns:
If the entry was properly updated

createFoodEntry

public long createFoodEntry(java.lang.String description,
                            java.lang.String calories,
                            java.lang.String protein,
                            java.lang.String total_fat,
                            java.lang.String carbs,
                            java.lang.String dietary_fiber,
                            java.lang.String sugar,
                            java.lang.String calcium,
                            java.lang.String iron,
                            java.lang.String sodium,
                            java.lang.String vitamin_c,
                            java.lang.String retinol,
                            java.lang.String saturated_fat,
                            java.lang.String cholesterol)
Creates a new entry in the exercise food entry database with the specified attributes. NOTE: Using the ContentValues isn't strictly necessary, but it automagically handles the SQL syntax for you.

Parameters:
title - - The title of this food entry.
distance - - The distance (in meters) estimated to have traveled.
time - - The amount of time (in milliseconds) the food entry took.
date - - The date according to the GregorianCalendar this is (in milliseconds).
type - - The type of exercise this was.
calories - - The estimated number of calories that were burned.
Returns:
The Row ID of this new entry.

deleteFoodEntry

public boolean deleteFoodEntry(long rowId)
Delete the food entry with the given rowId NOTE: rowId is that special Android identifier

Parameters:
rowId - id of food entry to delete
Returns:
true if deleted, false otherwise

getFoodMatches

public Cursor getFoodMatches(java.lang.String entry)

fetchAllFoodEntrys

public Cursor fetchAllFoodEntrys()
Return a Cursor over the list of all food entrys in the database NOTE: The cursor isn't a list itself, here's what it is: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/database/Cursor.html

Returns:
Cursor over all food entrys

fetchCalories

public long fetchCalories(long rowId)
                   throws SQLException
Convenience method that returns the kcal/g ratio of calories in the specified food.

Parameters:
rowId - - The ID of the food item to retrieve calories for.
Returns:
Throws:
SQLException

createMeal

public long createMeal(java.lang.String date,
                       java.lang.String calories)
Logs a meal in the database according to the specified data.

Parameters:
date - - The date of the meal in millis, see GregorianCalendar
calories - - The number of calories consumed in this meal
Returns:
The Row ID of this new meal

fetchAllMealsAfter

public Cursor fetchAllMealsAfter(long date)
Returns a cursor pointing to all meals consumed after the specified time.

Parameters:
date - - The time to begin the search from (in millis, see GregorianCalendar format)
Returns:
A Cursor pointing to all matchind database entries.

getCalsEatenSince

public int getCalsEatenSince(long date)
Returns all the logged calories the user has consumed since a certain time (in millis, see GregorianCalendar)

Parameters:
date - - The time in millis to begin the search from.
Returns:
The number of calories consumed since the referenced time.
